definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To pay heed to; notice ; to take notice of, to perceive . [from 16th c.]
( obsolete , transitive ) To pass comment on (something); to indicate, point out . [16th–18th c.]
( obsolete , transitive ) To mark (someone or something) out; to distinguish , to make notable. [17th c.]
( transitive , with clause as object ) To express in words or writing; to state, as an observation. [from 17th c.]
examples: He remarked that it was getting late.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , with preposition on ) To make a remark or remarks on , to comment on (something). [from 17th c.]

( intransitive , with preposition on ) To make a remark or remarks on , to comment on (something). [from 17th c.]
